title: Transportation
description: Public transport like trams, trains including ride share are available to use in Victoria however, masks are mandatory while travelling and waiting at station.

title: Mandatory face masks
description:
Have symptoms of COVID-19
While visiting hospital or care facility
Inside airport while arriving or leaving Melbourne
When you or your close contacts are diagnosed with COVID-19. In such circumstances you can leave your accommodation for permitted reason only
While waiting for COVID-19 result
Public transport and commercial passenger vehicles

title: Traffic-light permit system
description:
Victoria classifies regions of Australia as green, orange, or red, based on the region's COVID-19 risk. Non-Victorian residents cannot enter Victoria from a red zone
Check your current area here:
- Green: can apply for a permit and enter Victoria
-Orange: Can apply for a single-use permit and need to be tested for COVID-19 within 3 days of your arrival in Victoria and isolated until you get a negative test result. Testing location https://www.coronavirus.vic.gov.au/where-get-tested-covid-19
-Red: You can apply for permit only if youâ€™re Victorian resident. Otherwise, you will be fined $4957 and sent back

title: Apply for travel permit
description: You can apply for permit using the following link: https://www.service.vic.gov.au/services/border-permit/Transaction#details
